Convenience functions for calling some platform services


Functions

IPDR_API IPDR_MemoryFree (IPDR_ExporterHandle ExporterHandle, void *Buf)

IPDR_API_LINKAGE char * IPDR_FormatTimeGMTNow (IPDR_ExporterHandle ExporterHandle, char *Buf)
IPDR_API_LINKAGE char * IPDR_FormatTimeLocal (IPDR_ExporterHandle ExporterHandle, IPDR_Time Time, char *Buf)
IPDR_API_LINKAGE char * IPDR_FormatTimeGMT (IPDR_ExporterHandle ExporterHandle, IPDR_Time Time, char *Buf)

Detailed Description

These functions just call directly to the platform functions. The main difference is that these use a IPDR_ExporterHandle" rather than IPDR_PlatformServices.

Function Documentation

IPDR_API_LINKAGE char* IPDR_FormatTimeGMT (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
IPDR_Time  Time,
char *  Buf
) 
 

Format a time into ISO format in the GMT (UTC) time zone. See IPDR_FormatTimeGMT_t

Parameters:
Time seconds since "epoch" (1970-01-01T00:00:00 UTC (GMT))
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
Buf The buffer to get the date/time C-string (must be IPDR_TIME_FORMAT_LENGTH bytes long or more).
Returns:
The formatted value (using Buf's space).

IPDR_API_LINKAGE char* IPDR_FormatTimeGMTNow (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
char *  Buf
) 
 

Format the current time into ISO format in the GMT (UTC) time zone. See ::IPDR_FormatTimeLocalGMTNow_t

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
Buf The buffer to get the date/time C-string (must be IPDR_TIME_FORMAT_LENGTH bytes long or more).
Returns:
The formatted value (using Buf's space).
See also:

IPDR_API IPDR_GetTime (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
IPDR_Time *  Time
) 
 

Get the current time of day. See IPDR_GetTime_t

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
Time (output) seconds since "epoch" (1970-01-01T00:00:00 UTC (GMT))
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

IPDR_API IPDR_MemoryAllocate (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
size_t  Size,
void **  Buf
) 
 

Allocate a chunk of memory. See IPDR_MemoryAllocate_t

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
Size The number of bytes to allocate.
Buf (output) Pointer to the allocated memory; 0 (NULL) if failure (IPDR_ERR_ALLOCATION_FAILED).
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_ERR_ALLOCATION_FAILED or IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

IPDR_API IPDR_MemoryFree (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
void *  Buf
) 
 

Free a chunk of memory. See IPDR_MemoryFree_t

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
Buf The pointer to the memory allocated by IPDR_MemoryAllocate.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

IPDR_API IPDR_MemoryStatistics (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
unsigned int *  numAllocs,
unsigned int *  numFrees,
size_t *  bytesAllocated
) 
 

Get memory usage statistics. See IPDR_MemoryStatistics_t

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
numAllocs The number of calls to the IPDR_MemoryAllocate_t or IPDR_MemoryAllocateWithHdr_t services.
numFrees The number of calls to the IPDR_MemoryFree_t or IPDR_MemoryFreeWithHdr_t services.
bytesAllocated (output) The total number of bytes currently allocated.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

IPDR_API IPDR_RegisterPeriodicTimer (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
IPDR_TimerCallback_t  Callback,
void *  Arg,
int  Timeout,
IPDR_TimerID *  ID
) 
 

Register and start a periodic timer. See IPDR_RegisterPeriodicTimer_t

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
Callback Function to call when the timer expires.
Arg Argument to the callback function.
Timeout Timer period in milliseconds.
ID (output) Reference to the timer for deleting the timer.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
See also:
IPDR_UnregisterTimer_t

IPDR_API IPDR_RegisterTimer (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
IPDR_TimerCallback_t  Callback,
void *  Arg,
int  Timeout,
IPDR_TimerID *  ID
) 
 

Register and start a new timer. See IPDR_RegisterTimer_t

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
Callback Function to call when the timer expires.
Arg Argument to the callback function.
Timeout Timer period in milliseconds.
ID (output) Reference to the timer for reregistering or deleting the timer.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
See also:
IPDR_ReregisterTimer

IPDR_UnregisterTimer

IPDR_API IPDR_ReregisterTimer (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
IPDR_TimerCallback_t  Callback,
void *  Arg,
int  Timeout,
IPDR_TimerID *  ID
) 
 

Change the timeout for an existing timer. See IPDR_ReregisterTimer_t

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
Callback Function to call when the timer expires.
Arg Argument to the callback function.
Timeout Timer period in milliseconds.
ID (updated) Reference to the timer from IPDR_RegisterTimer_t.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

IPDR_API IPDR_SleepMS (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
long  Interval
) 
 

Sleep for a given number of milliseconds. See IPDR_SleepMS_t If the system clock is not sufficiently precise, the time interval is rounded up to the precision of the clock.

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
Interval The number of milliseconds to sleep.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

IPDR_API IPDR_UnregisterTimer (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
IPDR_TimerID  ID
) 
 

Cancel and delete an existing timer. See IPDR_UnregisterTimer_t

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
ID The timer reference from ::IPDR_RegisterTImer_t or ::IPDR_RegisterPeriodictTimer_t.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
See also:
IPDR_RegisterTimer_t

IPDR_RegisterPeriodictTimer_t
